content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function written in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split the markdown document by lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    
    code_blocks = []
    current_block = ""

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            push!(code_blocks, current_block)
            current_block = ""
        elseif startswith(line, "```")
            continue
        end
        
        # Add the line to the current code block
        if !isempty(current_block)
            current_block *= "\n"
        end
        current_block *= line[4:end]  # remove `    ` at the beginning of each line
    end
    
    join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
This function assumes that a code block starts with "```julia" and ends with "```". It ignores all other lines. If you have different conventions for defining code blocks, you will need to adjust the conditions accordingly.
